title: U.S. Embassy personnel in Haiti evacuated amid rising violence
description: The State Department has advised all American citizens to leave Haiti as soon as possible.

title: General declares himself Niger’s leader, citing ‘insecurity’ as reason for coup
description: Gen. Abdourahmane Tchiani said the “harsh reality of insecurity" had led the soldiers to overthrow President Mohamed Bazoum.

title: U.S. Embassy in Dublin issues security alert after assault on tourist
description: Americans in Dublin are advised to avoid walking alone following a group attack on a 57-year-old man from Buffalo.

title: A Ukrainian village’s final farewell to soldier highlights toll of war
description: As Ukraine's counteroffensive grinds on, a single soldier's funeral in a tiny village brings home the cost of a war whose casualties -- to both sides -- have been staggering

title: Utopia to blight: Surviving in Henry Ford’s lost jungle town
description: Fordlândia, the Midwestern city that the pioneering automaker built in the middle of the Brazilian Amazon, has fallen into ruin.

title: North Korea welcomes first post-pandemic visitors: China and Russia
description: Senior officials from Russia and China stood beside leader Kim Jong Un for a military parade, sending a clear message: Pyongyang has friends in Beijing and Moscow.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Kyiv claims gains in southeast as fighting intensifies
description: A Ukrainian official said forces “are gradually moving forward” south of Bakhmut, but “battles are quite tough.”

title: Ukrainians are breaking their ties with the Russian language
description: The repudiation of the Russian language in Ukraine is a stark failing of Putin's invasion, shattering the notion that he will unite historic "Russian lands."

title: The West saw Niger as a democratic bulwark. Then, a coup happened.
description: “Niger is a young democracy in a challenging part of the world,” Secretary of State Antony Blinken said in March. In this context, the turbulent events of the past couple days are a rude shock.
